meanings.definition: To ask for or obtain something without paying for it
meanings.sent1: He was always mooching snacks from his friends.
meanings.sent2: She mooched a ride to the party from her neighbor.
meanings.sent3: Instead of mooching, why not earn your own money?
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was mooching nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent5: The cat was caught mooching fish from the kitchen counter.

meanings.sent1: The kids were mooching around the park all afternoon.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys mooching through the bookstore on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The dog was caught mooching in circles in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were mooching across the sky lazily.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were mooching through the streets of the old town.

meanings.sent1: He was just mooching on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: She mooches around the house instead of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat was caught mooching in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were mooching in the sky, not moving at all.
meanings.sent5: The student was mooching in class, not paying attention.
